perturbation.original_text: For any Product or Solution sold to any perspective clients introduced by Bravatek registered with COMPANY via email to COMPANY's CEO and delivered through Bravatek or a COMPANY-designated distribution affiliate(s) or sales channel(s), Bravatek will receive a lead-finder fee, to be mutually discussed and finally decided by COMPANY at the range of minimum of 10% to maximum of 20% of project revenue, with an exact fee to be depending upon the overall project sales margin and cost of development and delivery of each project, payable NET 30 days after each client payment on delivered products received at COMPANY's bank account.
perturbation.changed_text: For any Product or Solution sold to any perspective clients introduced by Bravatek registered with COMPANY via email to COMPANY's CEO and delivered through Bravatek or a COMPANY-designated distribution affiliate(s) or sales channel(s), Bravatek will receive a lead-finder fee, to be mutually discussed and finally decided by COMPANY at the range of minimum of 10% to maximum of 20% of project revenue, with an exact fee to be depending upon the overall project sales margin and cost of development and delivery of each project, payable NET 45 days after each client payment on delivered products received at COMPANY's bank account.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction in the payment terms. Originally, payment was NET 30 days. Now it's NET 45 days, creating uncertainty about the payment deadline.

perturbation.original_text: The term of this Agreement is twelve (12) months from the date hereof, and will be automatically renewed for one (1) additional twelve month period unless either party shall notify the other in writing of its intention not to renew. Such notice must be given ninety (90) days prior to expiration of the original term. This Agreement may also be terminated by either party upon ninety (90) days written notice.
perturbation.changed_text: The term of this Agreement is twelve (12) months from the date hereof, and will be automatically renewed for one (1) additional twelve month period unless either party shall notify the other in writing of its intention not to renew. Such notice must be given sixty (60) days prior to expiration of the original term. This Agreement may also be terminated by either party upon ninety (90) days written notice.
perturbation.explanation: This creates a conflict regarding the renewal notice period. One sentence requires 90 days notice, while the other requires 60, creating ambiguity on the requirements for non-renewal.

perturbation.original_text: COMPANY shall indemnify Bravatek, its directors, officers and employees, for any and all damages, costs, expenses, and other liabilities, including reasonable attorney's fees and court costs incurred in connection with any third-party claim, action or proceeding arising from the negligence or intentional misconduct of COMPANY or breach of COMPANY of any of its obligations under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: COMPANY shall indemnify Bravatek, its directors, officers and employees, for any and all damages, costs, expenses, and other liabilities, including reasonable attorney's fees and court costs incurred in connection with any third-party claim, action or proceeding arising from the gross negligence or intentional misconduct of COMPANY or breach of COMPANY of any of its material obligations under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The added qualifiers create inconsistencies regarding what triggers indemnification. Originally any breach triggers it but now only material breaches of the agreement and gross negligence or intentional misconduct would trigger it.
